docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: North Korea, Donald Trump, Kitsch: Your Thursday Briefing

docs.snippet: When a Republican congressman was critically wounded in a shooting at a baseball game last summer, U.S. President Donald Trump dispatched his physician, an Iraq war veteran trained in emergency medicine, to the hospital to check on his condition.

headline.print_headline: Trump Taps Doctor, Decorated Diver to Rescue Veterans Affairs
headline.main: Trump Taps Doctor, Decorated Diver to Rescue Veterans Affairs

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump will not hire two lawyers to his legal team handling the special counsel's probe despite announcing their addition last week, Trump's personal lawyer said on Sunday, adding to uncertainty about the president's legal rep...

headline.print_headline: Trump Not Adding Two Lawyers to Legal Team, Citing Conflicts
headline.main: Trump Not Adding Two Lawyers to Legal Team, Citing Conflicts

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump on Sunday defended his decision to sign a $1.3 trillion federal spending bill despite his misgivings, pointing to billions in new funding for the military and national security.

headline.print_headline: Trump Defends $1.3T Spending Plan, Points to Military Gains
headline.main: Trump Defends $1.3T Spending Plan, Points to Military Gains

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump will not be adding two new lawyers to the legal team defending him in the special counsel's Russia investigation after all, one of the president's attorneys said Sunday.

headline.print_headline: 2 Lawyers Not Joining Trump Legal Team After All
headline.main: 2 Lawyers Not Joining Trump Legal Team After All

docs.snippet: The president has undermined the Affordable Care Act, but it “remains the law,” the administrator of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services said. But she encouraged the state to keep trying.

headline.print_headline: Trump Administration Blocks Proposal in Idaho to Circumvent Health Law
headline.main: Trump Administration Blocks Idaho’s Plan to Circumvent Health Law

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, on Tuesday asked a federal judge in Virginia to dismiss an indictment brought by Special Counsel Robert Mueller, saying the case falls outside the scope of Mueller's authority a...

headline.print_headline: Ex-Trump Campaign Manager Manafort Seeks to Dismiss Virginia Charges
headline.main: Ex-Trump Campaign Manager Manafort Seeks to Dismiss Virginia Charges

docs.snippet: When the reboot of "Roseanne" premieres on ABC on Tuesday, it picks up where the show left off in 1997 — with one notable difference.

headline.print_headline: 'Roseanne' Reboot Picks Up Where Show Left Off, Adds Trump
headline.main: 'Roseanne' Reboot Picks Up Where Show Left Off, Adds Trump

docs.snippet: Despite threats of retaliation from China over U.S. plans to impose tariffs on up to $60 billion in Chinese goods, Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin on Sunday said President Donald Trump had no intention of backing down and was not worried about a ...

headline.print_headline: Mnuchin: Trump Not Afraid of a Trade War With China-Fox News
headline.main: Mnuchin: Trump Not Afraid of a Trade War With China-Fox News

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's favorite TV network is increasingly serving as a West Wing casting call, as the president reshapes his administration with camera-ready personalities.

headline.print_headline: Trump Turns to Fox News as He Casts Staffers for West Wing
